title: New Immigration & Foreigners Act comes into effect in India, severe punishment for forging passport, visa
byline: A new Act that regulates matters related to foreigners and immigration and has provisions for heavy punishment for carrying a forged passport or visa came into effect in India on Monday (01).

title: More than 1000 killed in landslide in western Sudan
byline: More than 1000 people have been killed in a landslide that destroyed a village in the Marra Mountains area of western Sudan, leaving only one survivor.

title: 49 including 17 police officers arrested over bribery incidents in first seven months of 2025 – CIABOC
byline: A total of 49 individuals have been arrested in connection with bribery-related incidents during the first seven months of this year, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption said.

title: SLFP turns 74 today
byline: Today marks the 74th anniversary of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP).

title: Special commemorative ceremony and Traffic plan for 159th Police Day
byline: A special commemorative ceremony will be held tomorrow (03) at the Police Field Force Headquarters in celebration of the 159th Police Day.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: A few showers may occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: Belgium to recognise Palestinian state at UN General Assembly
byline: Belgium will recognise a Palestinian state at the U.N. General Assembly, Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot said on Tuesday, adding to international pressure on Israel after similar moves by Australia, Britain, Canada and France.

title: President to launch multiple development projects in North for second consecutive day
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to participate in a number of events and inaugurate several development projects in the Northern Province today, marking the second day of his official tour, according to the Presidential Media Division.

title: Court backlog must be cleared by December 31 – Judicial Service Commission
byline: The Judicial Service Commission (JSC) has directed that all pending case backlogs in courts must be cleared by December 31.

title: Proposed recruitment of 10,000 Sri Lankans to Thailand under review
byline: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Thailand Wijayanthi Edirisinghe has held discussions with the Director General of the Department of Employment of Thailand, Somchai Morakotsriwan to review progress on the proposed recruitment of 10,000 Sri Lankans to Thailand.

title: Dances With Wolves star Graham Greene dies aged 73
byline: Graham Greene, the Canadian First Nations actor who starred in films including Dances With Wolves, has died aged 73, his manager says.

title: Token strike at Ratnapura Teaching Hospital over director’s conduct – GMOA
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association has decided to stage a token strike today at the Ratnapura Teaching Hospital, in protest against the conduct of the Director of the hospital.

title: iPhone XS officially joins Apple’s Vintage product list, iPad 5 declared obsolete
byline: Apple has added the iPhone XS, launched in 2018, to its vintage product list, signalling the device is nearing the end of its official support lifecycle.

title: Italy’s Deputy Foreign Minister to arrive in Sri Lanka tomorrow
byline: Maria Tripodi, Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs of Italy and International Cooperation, will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka tomorrow (03).

title: Eight-hour traffic jams in Delhi suburb as rains wreak havoc
byline: Thousands of commuters in one of India’s wealthiest suburbs were stuck on roads for six to eight hours due to rain-triggered traffic gridlock on Monday.

title: Australia to tackle deepfake nudes, online stalking
byline: Australia said Tuesday (2) it will oblige tech giants to prevent online tools being used to create AI-generated nude images or stalk people without detection.

title: “There is no room for racist politics in the country again” – President pledges to people of North
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has affirmed that no opportunity will be given for the resurgence of racist politics in the country.

title: Donald Trump says India offered to remove tariffs on US goods
byline: US President Donald Trump says India has offered to cut its tariffs ‘to nothing’ even as he called the current trade stalemate with the country ‘a totally one sided disaster’.

title: Sri Lanka’s Lakshitha Karunarathna awarded at the Prestigious Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2025
byline: Wildlife photographer Lakshitha Karunarathna has once again brought pride to Sri Lanka by being awarded at the world-renowned Wildlife Photographer of the Year (WPY) competition, organized by the Natural History Museum, London.

title: Death toll from Afghanistan earthquake rises to 1,100
byline: At least 1,100 people have been killed and 3,500 others injured after a magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, according to Taliban officials.

title: Rapper ‘Maduwa’ arrested again with explosives
byline: Popular rapper Madhawa Prasad, known by his stage name ‘Maduwa’, who was recently arrested with a fake pistol, has been taken into custody once again—this time for the possession of explosives.

title: Heavy traffic opposite Presidential Secretariat due to a protest
byline: Vehicular movement along the Galle road opposite the Presidential Secretariat has been obstructed owing to a protest staged by retired public servants, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Acting Director of Police Cultural Division SSP Sathish Gamage further remanded
byline: The Acting Director of the Police Cultural Division, Senior Superintendent of Police Sathish Gamage, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption has been further remanded, until September 16, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: First coconut seed production unit in North launched by President
byline: The first coconut seed production unit in the Northern Province was inaugurated today in Pallai under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, as part of the Northern Coconut Triangle Project.

title: Gold rushes to record high above US$3,500 on US rate cut expectations
byline: Gold sailed past US$3,500 per ounce to a record high on Tuesday, as a weaker dollar and mounting expectations of a United States Federal Reserve interest rate cut in September boosted the precious metal’s appeal.

title: North Korea’s Kim arrives in Beijing in armoured train
byline: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has arrived in the Chinese capital Beijing, where he will be attending a military parade, reports say.

title: SLPP writes to Asgiriya Chief Prelate regarding ‘harassment’ of war heroes
byline: A letter has been directed by the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) to the Chief Prelate of the Asgiriya Chapter of Siam Nikaya, the Most Venerable Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thero, expressing concern over the ‘harassment’ of war heroes.

title: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister briefs diplomatic community ahead of UNHRC session
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath briefed the Colombo-based Diplomatic Corps today (September 02) at the Ministry on the latest developments in Sri Lanka.

title: 90-day detention orders obtained on 5 major underworld figures
byline: Police have obtained detention orders under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) to detain and interrogate five high-profile underworld figures, including ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, ‘Commando Salintha’, and three others, for a period of 90 days.

title: Sri Lanka’s future depends on innovative and socially conscious youth - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that focus is being placed on enhancing the quality of the agricultural sector by utilizing digital and innovative technologies.

title: ‘Harak Kata’ assassination plot foiled? Suspect nabbed with revolver
byline: A suspect who allegedly planned to shoot and kill notorious underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka alias ‘Karak Kata’ inside a court while disguised as a journalist, has been arrested by police.

title: Erdogan slams US decision to revoke Palestinian visas ahead of UN meeting
byline: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan said the United States should urgently revise its decision to revoke the visas of Palestinian officials and bar them from attending a gathering of world leaders at the United Nations this month in New York.
